episodeTitle: Hordy's Onslaught! The Retaliatory Plan Set Into Motion!
episodeTitleJapanese: ホーディ襲来 復讐計画の始まり
episodeTitleRomanized: Hōdi Shūrai - Fukushū Keikaku no Hajimari
description: Luffy escorts Shirahoshi toward the Sea Forest when they notice Hody Jones and Vander Decken IX heading to Ryugu Palace. Meanwhile, Robin defeats Ammo Knights and boards a Sea Bus, while Franky locates the Thousand Sunny with help from Den, Tom's younger brother. At Ryugu Palace, Hody and Decken invade to find the Straw Hats and Neptune already captured.

events.title: Luffy and Shirahoshi Journey to Sea Forest
events.description: Luffy continues to escort Princess Shirahoshi toward the Sea Forest, protecting her along the way. During their journey, Luffy notices something heading toward Ryugu Palace in the distance.
events.significance: Sets up Luffy's awareness of the impending attack on Ryugu Palace while he's away with Shirahoshi.

events.title: Robin Confronts Ammo Knights
events.description: Nico Robin waits at a Sea Bus stop when multiple Ammo Knights appear and demand she accompany them. Robin refuses and prepares to defend herself.
events.significance: Demonstrates Robin's combat capabilities post-timeskip and her determination to reach the Sea Forest Poneglyph.

events.title: Robin Uses Gigantesco Mano (Off-Screen)
events.description: Robin incapacitates all the Ammo Knights using her Gigantesco Mano technique, though the actual execution happens off-screen. She then boards the Sea Bus heading to the Sea Forest.
events.significance: First mention of Robin's enhanced post-timeskip abilities, specifically her giant limb techniques developed during the two-year training period.

events.title: Den's Debut - Tom's Younger Brother
events.description: Franky finds the Thousand Sunny in the Sea Forest's ship graveyard and meets Den, a Bering wolffish merman who reveals himself to be Tom's younger brother. Franky is surprised they look nothing alike.
events.significance: Introduces Den as a connection to Franky's past and Tom's legacy. Provides an opportunity to explain fish-man genetics.

events.title: Fish-Man Genetics Explanation
events.description: Den explains the unique genetics of fish-men and merfolk, revealing that they carry dormant ancestral genes that can skip generations. This means siblings can look completely different based on which ancestor's traits they inherit, explaining why he and Tom appear so different.
events.significance: Provides important world-building information about fish-man biology and genetics, explaining the diversity within fish-man families.

events.title: Jinbe Waits at Sea Forest
events.description: Jinbe is shown waiting patiently outside Fish-Man Island at the Sea Forest for Luffy to arrive, as he is currently a wanted criminal and cannot enter the island territory.
events.significance: Sets up Jinbe's planned meeting with Luffy and establishes his current status as an outlaw.

events.title: Hody Jones and Vander Decken Invade Ryugu Palace
events.description: Hody Jones and Vander Decken IX, riding on sea monsters with their forces, successfully breach the defenses of Ryugu Palace after a captured human pirate opens the gate and connecting corridor. They arrive expecting to capture Shirahoshi and overthrow Neptune.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Hody's coup attempt and the major conflict of the Fish-Man Island Arc. This invasion sets in motion the battle for Fish-Man Island's future.

quotes.text: This will be the last day of the Ryugu Kingdom. We will be the new rulers of the seafloor.
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody declares his intention to overthrow the kingdom as he invades the palace

events.title: Invaders Find Straw Hats Already Captured
events.description: Upon entering the palace, Hody and Decken discover that the Straw Hats and King Neptune are already bound and captured, finding the situation suspiciously convenient. They wonder if it might be a trap.
events.significance: Creates tension as Hody questions the coincidence, though he ultimately proceeds with his plan.

events.title: Hody Revealed as Former Neptune Army Soldier
events.description: When the Minister of the Right curses Hody Jones for causing chaos on Fish-Man Island, Neptune recognizes him as a former talented soldier of the Neptune Army. Hody reveals he only joined the army to gain combat experience for his true goal.
events.significance: Reveals Hody's infiltration and long-term planning, showing he was never loyal to the kingdom and used his position to prepare for this coup.

quotes.text: I only joined the army to gain combat experience.
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody reveals his true intentions for joining the Neptune Army

events.title: Neptune Accuses Luffy of Kidnapping Shirahoshi
events.description: Neptune accuses Luffy of kidnapping Princess Shirahoshi, not knowing that Luffy is actually protecting her. He theorizes that Megalo hid her in his mouth, which the guards dismiss as too bizarre to be true.
events.significance: Shows the misunderstanding between Neptune and the Straw Hats, adding to the confusion of the situation.

events.title: Vander Decken Leaves to Pursue Shirahoshi
events.description: Upon learning that Shirahoshi is genuinely missing from the palace, Vander Decken IX becomes enraged. He uproots coral and commands it to locate her, then leaves the palace to pursue her, declaring she will die in a sea of blood if she becomes someone else's.
events.significance: Separates the two villains and establishes Decken's obsessive pursuit of Shirahoshi, setting up his direct confrontation with Luffy and the princess.

quotes.text: The princess will die in a sea of blood if she becomes someone else's.
quotes.speaker: Vander Decken IX
quotes.context: Decken's possessive and threatening declaration about Shirahoshi

events.title: Hody Floods Ryugu Palace
events.description: Hody Jones demonstrates his immense strength by crushing a palace wall with his bare hand, causing water to flood into Ryugu Palace. This act endangers all the air-breathing captives inside.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hody's raw power and his willingness to kill indiscriminately, including his own subordinates. The flooding creates a life-threatening situation for the captured Straw Hats and Neptune's forces.

events.title: Hody Uses Yabusame Attack
events.description: Hody Jones launches his Yabusame (Archer Shark) attack, burying his hand in water and pulling it to create powerful water droplets that fire like arrows. The attack injures King Neptune and several of his soldiers.
events.significance: First appearance of Hody's signature water-based attack technique, demonstrating fish-man karate abilities. The attack recalls Arlong's similar techniques from earlier in the series.

quotes.text: This will be the last day of the Ryugu Kingdom. We will be the new rulers of the seafloor.
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Hody's declaration as he invades Ryugu Palace

quotes.text: I only joined the army to gain combat experience.
quotes.speaker: Hody Jones
quotes.context: Revealing his infiltration of the Neptune Army

quotes.text: The princess will die in a sea of blood if she becomes someone else's.
quotes.speaker: Vander Decken IX

themes.description: The episode explores Hody's revenge-driven plan to overthrow the Ryugu Kingdom, representing the cycle of hatred and racism that has plagued fish-man and human relations.
themes.symbolism: Hody's invasion represents inherited hatred - anger passed down without personal experience of oppression.

themes.description: Hody's revelation that he joined the Neptune Army solely to gain combat experience represents deep betrayal and long-term planning for destruction.
themes.symbolism: The flooding of the palace symbolizes Hody washing away the old order to establish his vision of fish-man supremacy.

themes.description: Vander Decken's pursuit of Shirahoshi demonstrates toxic obsession, where he would rather kill her than see her with someone else.
themes.symbolism: Decken's thrown weapons that endlessly pursue their target mirror his inability to let go of his obsession.

characterSpotlights.development: Hody's character is developed through the revelation of his former position in the Neptune Army and his demonstration of ruthless power, establishing him as a serious threat.
keyActions: Invades Ryugu Palace with his forces
Reveals his infiltration of the Neptune Army
Floods the palace by crushing a wall
quotes: This will be the last day of the Ryugu Kingdom. We will be the new rulers of the seafloor.
I only joined the army to gain combat experience.

characterSpotlights.development: Decken's obsessive nature is highlighted as he abandons the palace invasion to pursue Shirahoshi, showing his single-minded fixation.
keyActions: Threatens to kill the princess if she belongs to another
quotes: The princess will die in a sea of blood if she becomes someone else's.

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates her enhanced post-timeskip combat abilities and determination to reach the Sea Forest Poneglyph.
keyActions: Boards Sea Bus to Sea Forest

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends Robin's confrontation with the Ammo Knights, though the actual battle remains off-screen in both versions.
Den's explanation of fish-man genetics is expanded in the anime to provide more detail about ancestral inheritance.

trivia.fact: This episode marks a change in the eyecatcher format, introducing a new version featuring the One Piece logo with Luffy's silhouette displayed after the commercial break.
Den is revealed to be Tom's younger brother, despite looking completely different due to fish-man genetics allowing traits from different ancestors to appear.
Hody's Yabusame technique is visually similar to Arlong's water-based attacks from the Arlong Park Arc, establishing a connection between their fighting styles.
This episode adapts Chapter 616 'Anniversary for Revenge,' covering pages 2-17 of the manga chapter.
